data.text:
Former professional tennis player Andre Agassi is an Olympic gold medalist and eight-time Grand Slam champion, he holds the record as one of the greatest global superstars in the history of racquet sport. André, who picked up his tennis racquet at the age of two, has not only been in the spotlight for years for dominating the sport from the 1990s through the mid-2000s, but also for his beauty , his fashion sense and raising children who quickly pick up where he left off. Since turning professional in 1986, Agassi has never failed to impress the tennis community as a player and coach. The accomplished American tennis player hung up his racquet in 2006 and ended up coaching tennis in 2017. Until

the biography

The former No. A tennis player was born on American soil, precisely in Las Vegas (Nevada), on April 29, 1970, to Emmanuel “Mike” Agassi (father) and Elizabeth “Betty” Agassi (mother). , a breast cancer survivor. After he was born, his parents called him Andre Kirk Agassi. His father gave him the nickname “Kirk” in honor of his Armenian American billionaire friend, whom he met some time in 1963 while working as a waiter at the Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas. The retired tennis star is the last child of his parents. His elder siblings are named Rita (wife of legendary American tennis player Pancho Gonzales from 1984 to 1989), Tami Agassi (his sister) and Philip Agassi (his brother).

Thirteen-year-old André was enrolled at Nick Bollettieri’s Tennis Academy in Florida and honed his tennis skills. At the time, his father had the money to keep him at the Academy for just three months, but after watching the tennis star play for thirty minutes, Bollettieri changed his mind and asked André’s father to take over. his check and forgetting to pay a penny for his son. A year before this incident, precisely at the age of twelve, André Agassi competed and won the title of the Double Indoor 14 National Championship in 1982 which was held in Chicago. He recorded the victory with his longtime friend, teammate Roddy Parks.

Agassi reportedly dropped out of school in the ninth grade. He has an autobiography subtitled: “Open”.

Andre Agassi’s father

It’s natural for sons to be passionate about their dad, but when you have a dad who’s an entertainer or professional sportsman, you really have something to aspire to. Like most sons who have followed in their father’s footsteps, Andre Agassi owes his success in the world of tennis to his father, who was his coach. Very inspired by his father’s expertise in sports, he clung to him since childhood and eventually took up the same profession at the right time. As you already know, the Agassi family has a long history in athletics – tennis and boxing to be precise.

André’s father was born Emmanuel B. Agassian, in Salmas, Persian Empire, on December 25, 1930. According to records, his name was anglicized as Emmanuel “Mike” Agassi by one of his ancestors in order to avoid persecution at the time, as he had been brought up in a Christian household. in Tehran. He is a former boxer born to a Ukrainian Armenian father from kyiv, David Agassi, and a Turkish Armenian mother.

Emmanuel developed a strong interest in tennis after meeting American and British servicemen, who taught him the game. As a boxer, he participated in combat representing Iran in the 1948 Summer Olympics and 1952. The former Agassi, trained by iconic German-Polish boxer Hans Ziglarski, lost in the first round both times, however.

Andre’s father officially changed his name to “MikeAgassi” in 1952 when he moved to Chicago with his brother Samuel. A responsible father of four, Emmanuel met his wife, Elizabeth Dudley, through a mutual friend shortly after graduating from Roosevelt University, located in Chicago, Illinois. They were married on August 19, 1959, at a Methodist church on Chicago’s North Side, before moving to Las Vegas, Nevada after Agassi landed a job as a waiter at the Tropicana Hotel. At the time, their first child, Rita Agassi, was two years old, while their first son, Philip (born in 1962) was only eight days old. Dudley and her husband had their third child. A girl called Tamara (Tami) Agassi was in 1967,

The former Iranian tennis coach/boxer, who currently lives in Las Vegas, USA, has an autobiography titled: The Agassi Story. It was released in 2004.

Net value

Before quitting the sport he loved so much in 2006, Andre Agassi recorded an impressive career earnings of $31.2 million. In 2018, his net worth was estimated at $175 million, making him one of the richest tennis players of all time.

Family – wife and children

When we told you the Agassi’s had a long tennis history, that’s what we meant Andre must be a proud husband and father, surrounded by tennis stars who have carved out a place for themselves in the racket sport! Agassi is happy to marry Stefanie Maria, former No. 1 professional tennis player and 22-time Grand Slam winner. Better known as Steffi, André’s wife was born in Mannheim, Germany on June 14, 1969. The 1.76m beauty declared ‘I do’ to the world champion in 2001 and their union is blessed with two amazing children – Jaz Elle Agassi and Jaden Gil Agassi.

Born to two tennis powerhouses that are ranked Jaden Gill Agassi has become one of the top athletes to watch. Unlike his parents, however, the young man is interested in baseball, which he adopted after playing different sports, including football. Regardless, both Hall of Fame tennis players are very supportive of their son’s career. He was born at Valley Hospital in Las Vegas Valley on October 26, 2001. His only sister, Jaz, was born in 2003.

the size

The listed height for the right-handed service technician is 180 centimeters, which is just right for his body weight: 75 pounds (165 pounds). He is bald and has dark brown eyes.
